required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Measure the Effect of Brain Stimulation on Hand Strength and Function in Patients With Brain Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Intraoperative Cortical Stimulation on Hand Strength and Function During Awake Craniotomies

brief_summary.textblock: The neurosurgical standard of care for treating a patient with a tumor invading hand primary motor cortex (M1) includes performing a craniotomy with intraoperative direct electrical stimulation (DES) mapping and to resect as much tumor as possible without a resultant permanent neurological deficit. However, the subjective nature of current intraoperative hand motor assessments do not offer a comprehensive understanding of how hand strength and function may be impacted by resection. Additionally, there is a paucity of data to inform how altering DES parameters may effect motor mapping. Here, the investigators seek to demonstrate a feasible, standardized protocol to quantitatively assess hand strength and function and systematically assess several stimulation parameters to improve intraoperative measurements and better understand how cortical stimulation interacts with underlying neural function.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Hand strength - Manual Motor Scale (0-5)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-op, intra-op, 1 week post-op and 3 months post-op; 2 visits 3 weeks apart for healthy volunteers
primary_outcome.description: Quantitative assessment on a scale of 0 - 5 5 - normal strength 4 - give away weakness 3 - movement against gravity 2 - movement in anti-gravity position 1 - muscle twitch 0 - no movement

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Hand strength - Dynamometer grip and pinch strength (Newtons)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-op, intra-op, 1 week post-op and 3 months post-op; 2 visits 3 weeks apart for healthy volunteers
primary_outcome.description: Scored using force production in kilograms (0-90) Standardized procedure for positioning

primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-op, intra-op, 1 week post-op and 3 months post-op; 2 visits 3 weeks apart for healthy volunteers
primary_outcome.description: The Cyberglove III collects data on the movement of the joints in the hand. Subjects will be asked to wear the Cyberglove III while doing various tasks. Velocity will be measured in degrees per second.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-op, intra-op, 1 week post-op and 3 months post-op; 2 visits 3 weeks apart for healthy volunteers
primary_outcome.description: The Cyberglove III collects data on the movement of the joints in the hand. Subjects will be asked to wear the Cyberglove III while doing various tasks. Finger individuation will be calculated using joint angles.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-op, intra-op, 1 week post-op and 3 months post-op; 2 visits 3 weeks apart for healthy volunteers
primary_outcome.description: The Cyberglove III collects data on the movement of the joints in the hand. Subjects will be asked to wear the Cyberglove III while doing various tasks. Smoothness will be calculated using joint angles.

intervention.intervention_name: Intraoperative Brain Simulation - Alternate Stimulation Parameters
intervention.description: Additional stimulation parameters outside of standard of care during intraoperative brain stimulation to aid in motor mapping.

study_pop.textblock: Individuals with a clinical indication for an awake craniotomy with motor mapping and healthy volunteers.

criteria.textblock:
AWAKE CRANIOTOMY COHORT
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age 18+
2. Ability to understand a written informed consent document, and the willingness to sign it
3. Radiographic evidence of tumor on MRI (i.e. non-enhancing) invading primary motor cortex in the non-dominant hemisphere.
4. Karnofsky performance status (KPS) â‰¥ 70
5. Normal or near normal motor strength (i.e., at least 3/5 in relevant areas)
6. Normal or near normal speech (Can consistently name at least 4/5 cards)
7. Free of other illness, in the judgment of the investigator, that may shorten life expectancy
8. Willing and able to participate in all aspects of the study
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Presence of other malignancy not in remission
2. Evidence of bi-hemispheric or widespread tumor involvement
3. Medically high-risk surgical candidate
4. History of recent scalp or systemic infection
5. Presence of other implants or foreign bodies in the head
6. Inability to receive an MRI for any reason
7. Inability to receive cortical stimulation for any reason
8. Presence of implanted cardiac device (such as a pacemaker or defibrillator)
HEALTHY VOLUNTEER COHORT
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age 18+
2. Ability to understand a written informed consent document, and the willingness to sign it
3. Normal or near normal motor strength (i.e., 5/5 in relevant areas)
4. Normal or near normal speech (Can consistently name at least 4/5 cards)
5. Free of other illness, in the judgment of the investigator, that may shorten life expectancy
6. Willing and able to participate in all aspects of the study
Exclusion Criteria:
1. History or presence of malignancy within the last 3 years, except subjects who have been treated successfully with no recurrence for > 1 year of basal cell or squamous cell carcinoma of the skin or in-situ cervical cancer
2. Decreased motor strength (i.e. 4/5 or in relevant areas).
3. Atypical form of the hand interfering with their ability to perform the actions requested by the study team
4. Any other significant pre-existing medical conditions that, in the judgment of the Investigator, may increase the risks associated with study participation, or would preclude successful participation in the study.
